story:
As-salamu alayki, little one! Tonight, I'm going to tell you a special story, just for you.

Once upon a time, in the beautiful deserts of Sudan, where the sun dips into the horizon and paints the sky with hues of orange and pink, there was a magical market that happened only under the light of the full moon.

In this market, all the creatures of the desert came to buy and sell their wares, from the merchants of spices and silks to the wisest of wisemen and the most cunning of camels. But there was one stall that caught the attention of all who passed by: the golden stall of the Moon's Gift.

Behind the stall stood a wise old man with skin as dark as the night and eyes that twinkled like the stars. He was known as Khalid, the Keeper of the Moon's Gift, and he had the most precious treasures in all the land. For every year, on the night of the full moon, Khalid would receive a special gift from the moon herself, and he would sell it to the one who was most deserving.

One year, your mother, who was just a little girl like you, stumbled upon the market while chasing after a particularly curious goat who had wandered away from her flock. As she wandered through the stalls, she came across Khalid's stand and was mesmerized by the glittering jewels and the sweet scent of frankincense.

Khalid looked at her with his twinkling eyes and said, "Ah, little one, I have been waiting for you. Tonight, the moon has brought me a special gift, and it is meant just for you." And with that, he presented her with a small, delicate box adorned with intricate patterns of silver and gold.

When she opened the box, she found a tiny, shimmering stone that glowed with a soft, blue light. Khalid told her that it was the Moon's Gift, and it would bring her good fortune, wisdom, and strength. And from that day on, your mother carried the stone with her, and it guided her through the challenges of growing up, and she became a wise and brave woman, loved by all who knew her.

And now, my dear daughter, I want you to have your own Moon's Gift. I want you to know that you are special, and that the moon is shining just for you. Close your eyes, and as you do, I want you to imagine that the moon is sending you a special gift, one that will guide you through your own journey of life.

As you sleep, may your dreams be sweet, and may the moon's light guide you on your path. And when you wake up tomorrow, I want you to remember that you are strong, brave, and deserving of all the magic that the world has to offer.

As-salamu alayki, little one. May the blessings of the moon be upon you.
